source_sentence: 雜阿含經卷第二十五
translation: Zaohan jing, vol. 25

source_sentence: 宋天竺三藏求那跋陀羅譯
translation: Song Dynasty Tripiṭaka Translated by *Guṇabhadra

source_sentence: （六四〇）爾時，世尊告尊者阿難：「此摩偷羅國，將來世當有商人子，名曰掘多，掘多有子，名優波掘多，我滅度後百歲，當作佛事，於教授師中最為第一。
translation: (640) It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Venerable Ānanda, "In a future life in this country of Mahākauṣṭhila, there will be a merchant named Kukkuṭa, and Kukkuṭa will have a son named Upagupta who, a hundred years after I die, will become a minister of the Buddha and will be the foremost among teachers.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝遙見彼青色叢林不？」
translation: Do you see that blue-colored grove from afar?"

source_sentence: 阿難白佛：「唯然，已見。
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Yes, I've seen it.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 是處名為優留曼茶山，如來滅後百歲，此山當有那吒跋置迦阿蘭若處，此處隨順寂默最為第一。」
translation: This place is called Mount Urumañjanā, and a hundred years after the Tathāgata's death, there will be a place on this mountain called the Nārāvajña Araṇyakāḥ, which is the most distinguished for its compliant silence."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊作是念：「我若以教法付囑人者，恐我教法不得久住；若付囑天者，恐我教法亦不得久住，世間人民則無有受法者。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān had this thought, "If I were to entrust the teaching to humans, I'm afraid my teaching wouldn't last long; if I were to entrust it to gods, I'm afraid my teaching wouldn't last long either, and there wouldn't be any people in the world who would accept the teaching.

source_sentence: 我今當以正法付囑人、天，諸天、世人共攝受法者，我之教法則千歲不動。」
translation: Now, I will entrust the right teaching to humans and gods, and the gods and people of the world will collect together those who accept the teaching, so my teaching won't budge for a thousand years."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊起世俗心。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān arouse a worldly mind.

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋及四大天王知佛心念，來詣佛所，稽首禮足，退坐一面。
translation: Knowing what the Buddha was thinking, the god Indra and the four celestial kings came to the Buddha, bowed their heads at their feet, and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告天帝釋及四大天王：「如來不久當於無餘涅槃而般涅槃，我般涅槃後，汝等當護持正法。」
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed Śakra and the four celestial kings, "The Tathāgata will soon attain parinirvāṇa without remainder, and after I attain parinirvāṇa, you must safeguard the true teaching."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊復告東方天王：「汝當於東方護持正法。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān again addressed the god king of the east, "You must safeguard the right teaching in the east."

source_sentence: 次告南方、西方、北方天王：「汝當於北方護持正法。
translation: Next, he addressed the god kings of the South, West, and North, "You must safeguard the right teaching in the North.

source_sentence: 過千歲後，我教法滅時，當有非法出於世間，十善悉壞。
translation: After a thousand years, when my teaching ceases, there will be what's not the Dharma that comes out of the world, and the ten good qualities will all perish.

source_sentence: 閻浮提中，惡風暴起，水雨不時，世多飢饉，雨則災雹，江河消滅，華果不成，人無光澤，蟲村鬼村悉皆磨滅，飲食失味，珍寶沈沒，人民服食麁澁草木。
translation: In Jambudvīpa, bad winds will rage, water and rain will fall from time to time, the world will be starved, rain will cause disasters and hail, rivers will disappear, flowers and fruits won't be produced, people won't have shine, villages of insects and ghosts will all perish, food and drink will lose their taste, treasures will sink, and people will eat coarse grass and wood.

source_sentence: 「時，有釋迦王、耶槃那王、鉢羅婆王、兜沙羅王，眾多眷屬。
translation: "At the time, there was King Śākyamuni, King Yavana, King Paranirmita, King Tushara, and a great many of their retinues.

source_sentence: 如來頂骨、佛牙、佛鉢安置東方。
translation: The bones of the Tathāgata's head, the Buddha's tooth, and the Buddha's bowl were placed in the east.

source_sentence: 西方有王，名鉢羅婆，百千眷屬，破壞塔寺，殺害比丘。
translation: To the west, there was a king named Paranirmita with a hundred thousand retinues who destroyed stūpas and temples and killed monks.

source_sentence: 北方有王，名耶槃那，百千眷屬，破壞塔寺，殺害比丘。
translation: In the north, there was a king named Yavana with a hundred thousand retinues who destroyed stūpas and temples and killed monks.

source_sentence: 南方有王，名釋迦，百千眷屬，破壞塔寺，殺害比丘。
translation: In the south, there's a king named Śākyamuni with a hundred thousand retinues who destroys stūpas and kills monks.

source_sentence: 東方有王，名兜沙羅，百千眷屬，破壞塔寺，殺害比丘。
translation: In the east, there's a king named Dhusāra with a hundred thousand retinues who destroys stūpas and temples and kills monks.

source_sentence: 四方盡亂，諸比丘來集中國。
translation: In the midst of the chaos in the four directions, the monks came to concentrate their country.

source_sentence: 「時，拘睒彌國有王，名摩因陀羅西那，其王生子，手似血塗，身似甲冑，有大勇力。
translation: "Then, there was a king of Kauśāmbī named Mahindrasena, who gave birth to a son with hands like blood and a body like armor and great courage.

source_sentence: 其生之日，五百大臣生五百子，皆類王子，血手冑身。
translation: On the day he was born, 500 ministers gave birth to 500 sons, all of whom resembled princes with bloody hands and armor.

source_sentence: 「時，拘睒彌國，一日雨血。
translation: "One day, blood rained down in the kingdom of Kauśāmbī.

source_sentence: 拘睒彌王見此惡相，即大恐怖，請問相師。
translation: When the king of Kauśāmbī saw this bad appearance, he became terrified and asked the fortune teller about it.

source_sentence: 相師白王：『王今生子，當王閻浮提，多殺害人，生子七日，字曰難當，年漸長大。
translation: The fortune teller told the king, 'Now, the king has given birth to a son who will be king of Jambudvīpa and will often kill and injure people.

source_sentence: 時，四惡王從四方來殺人民，摩因陀羅西那王聞則恐怖。』
translation: When the four evil kings came from the four directions to kill the people, King Mahindrasena was terrified when he heard about them.'

source_sentence: 「時，有天神告言：『大王且立難當為王，足能降伏彼四惡王。』
translation: "A god then told him, 'Great king, why don't you make Nandanarman king, for he'll be able to subdue those four evil kings?'

source_sentence: 時，摩因陀羅西那王受天神教，即捨位與子，以髻中明珠冠其子首，集諸大臣，香水灌頂。
translation: Then, having been instructed by the gods, King Mahindrasena relinquished his position and gave it to his son, placed a bright pearl in his topknot over his son's head, and gathered his ministers together to consecrate him with perfume.

source_sentence: 召五百大臣同日生子，身被甲冑，從王出征，與四惡王大眾戰；勝，殺害都盡，王閻浮提，治在拘睒彌鞞國。」
translation: He summoned five hundred ministers to give birth to his son on the same day, and they went out from the king's army, wearing armor, to fight the four evil kings; they were victorious, killed and destroyed them all, and the king, Jambudvīpa, ruled the country of Kauśāmbīpa."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告四大天王：「巴連弗國，於彼國當有婆羅門，名曰阿耆尼達多，通達比陀經論，彼婆羅門當納妻。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the four celestial kings, "In that country, there will be a brāhmaṇa named Agnidatta who's well-versed in the sūtras and treatises of the Bhītas, and that brāhmaṇa will accept a wife.

source_sentence: 彼時，中陰眾生當來與其作子，入母胎中時，彼母欲與人論議。
translation: When a sentient being of the intermediate aggregate comes to be with him as a child and enters his mother's womb, she wants to talk to someone about it.

source_sentence: 彼婆羅門即問諸相師，相師答云：『是胎中眾生當了達一切論，故令母生如是論議之心，欲將人論議。』
translation: The brāhmaṇa then asked the masters of signs, and they replied, 'It's because sentient beings in the womb will comprehend all the treatises that they will give rise to this kind of discursive thought in the mother, which desires to put people into discourse.'

source_sentence: 如是日月滿足，出生母胎，以為童子，了達一切經論，恒以經論教授五百婆羅門子，及餘諸論教授餘人，以醫方教醫方者，如是有眾多弟子。
translation: Thus, when the sun and moon are fulfilled, they emerge from their mother's womb, become a child, comprehend all the sūtras and treatises, teach 500 Brāhmaṇa disciples with the sūtras and treatises, teach others with the treatises, and teach prescriptions to doctors, and so on, they have many disciples.

source_sentence: 有眾多弟子故，名曰弟子。
translation: Because there are many disciples, he's called a disciple.

source_sentence: 次當從父母求出家學道，乃至父母聽其出家，彼即於我法中出家學道，通達三藏，善能說法，辯才巧妙，言語談說，攝多眷屬。」
translation: Next, they'll seek to leave home and train on the path from their parents, even if their parents hear them leave home, and then they'll leave home and train on the path in our teaching, become well-versed in the Tripiṭaka, be skilled in expounding the Dharma, be eloquent, speak eloquently, and gather many followers."

source_sentence: 又復，世尊告四大天王：「即此巴連弗邑國中，當有大商主，名曰須陀那，中陰眾生來入母胎。
translation: Again, the Bhagavān addressed the four celestial kings, "In this country of Pāṭaliputra, there will be a great merchant named Sudāna whose intermediate aggregate sentient beings come to enter his mother's womb.

source_sentence: 彼眾生入母胎時，令母質直柔和，無諸邪想，諸根寂靜。
translation: When that sentient being enters his mother's womb, it causes her to be straight and gentle, free of wrong thoughts, and her faculties are quiescent.

source_sentence: 「時，彼商主即問相師，相師答曰：『胎中眾生極為良善，故令母如是，乃至諸根寂靜。』
translation: "The merchant then asked the fortuneteller about this, and he answered, 'The sentient being in the womb is extremely good; therefore, it makes the mother thus, even if her faculties are quiescent.'

source_sentence: 至月滿足，便生童子，名曰修羅他。
translation: When the moon was full, a young child named Sholāta was born.

source_sentence: 年紀漸長，乃至啟白父母，求出家學道。
translation: As he grew older, he revealed to his parents that he wanted to leave home and train on the path.

source_sentence: 父母即聽，於我法中出家學道，勤行精進，修習道業，便得漏盡，證阿羅漢果。
translation: His parents then listened, leaving home to train on the path in our teaching, and he diligently cultivated the conduct of the path so that he would end the contaminants and realize the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 然寡聞、少欲、知足及少知，舊居在山藪林間，山名揵陀摩羅。
translation: Still, they had few friends, few desires, knew their own limitations, and little knowledge, and they used to live in a forest in a mountainous region called Gandhamāra.

source_sentence: 「時，彼聖人恒來為難當王說法。
translation: "At the time, that sage always came to preach for King Nandanavana.

source_sentence: 彼父王當無常，無常之日，難當見父過世，兩手抱父屍，悲號啼哭，憂惱傷心。
translation: That king's father will be impermanent, and on the day when he's impermanent, Nandanarman will see his father pass away, put his arms around his father's corpse, lament and wail, and be sad and distressed.

source_sentence: 時，彼三藏將多眷屬來詣王所，為王說法，王聞法已，憂惱即止，於佛法中生大敬信，而發聲唱言：『自今以後，我施諸比丘無恐畏，適意為樂。』
translation: When the tripiṭaka sent many of his retinue to the king to preach to him, the king heard the teaching, and his grief and distress stopped.

source_sentence: 而問比丘：『前四惡王毀滅佛法有幾年歲？』
translation: He asked the monks, 'How many years had the four evil kings previously destroyed the Buddha's teaching?'

source_sentence: 諸比丘答云：『經十二年。』
translation: The monks replied, 'It's been twelve years.'

source_sentence: 王心念口言，作師子吼：『我當十二年中，當供養五眾，乃至辦諸供具。』
translation: The king's mind thought and spoke, and he made a lion's roar, 'For twelve years, I will make offerings to the five congregations and prepare offerings.'

source_sentence: 即便行施，行施之日，天當降香澤之雨，遍閻浮提，一切實種皆得增長。
translation: Even as he makes these offerings, on the day he makes them, the gods rain down fragrant water all over Jambudvīpa, and all the real seeds will grow.

source_sentence: 諸方人眾皆持供養，來詣拘睒彌國，供養眾僧。
translation: People from all over the world make offerings and come to Kauśāmbī to make offerings to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 「時，諸比丘大得供養。
translation: "At the time, the monks were greatly endowed.

source_sentence: 諸比丘輩食人信施，而不讀誦經書，不薩闍為人受經。
translation: Those monks ate the faithful gifts of others but didn't read the sūtras or accept them for others.

source_sentence: 戲論過日，眠臥終夜，貪著利養，好自嚴飾，身著妙服，離諸出要、寂靜、出家、三菩提樂。
translation: They spend more days talking and more nights sleeping and lying down, longing for profit, adorn themselves well, wear fine clothing, and part with the essentials, tranquility, renunciation, and the three bodhi pleasures.

source_sentence: 形類比丘，離沙門功德，是法中之大賊，助作末世壞正法幢，建惡魔幢，滅正法炬，然煩惱火，壞正法鼓，毀正法輪，消正法海，壞正法山，破正法城，拔正法樹，毀禪定智慧，斷戒瓔珞，污染正道。
translation: Such monks, devoid of ascetic merit, are great thieves in the Dharma, helping to destroy the banner of the right Dharma, build the banner of Māra, extinguish the torch of the right Dharma, make it a fire of affliction, disrupt the drum of the right Dharma, disfigure the wheel of the right Dharma, sink the ocean of the right Dharma, destroy the mountain of the right Dharma, break down the city of the right Dharma, uproot the tree of the right Dharma, disparage meditation and wisdom, cut off the necklace of precepts, and pollute the right path in terminal times.

source_sentence: 「時，彼天、龍、鬼神、夜叉、乾闥婆等，於諸比丘所生惡意，毀訾諸比丘，厭惡、遠離，不復相親，異口同音：『嗚呼！
translation: "At the time, those gods, dragons, ghosts, yakṣas, and gandharvas bore ill will toward the monks, disparaged them, detested and rejected them, and stopped being close to them, all speaking with one voice, saying, 'Whoops!

source_sentence: 如是惡比丘，不應於如來法中。』
translation: Such a bad monk shouldn't be in the Tathāgata's teaching.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『非吉行惡行，　　行諸邪見法，　　此諸愚癡人，　　打壞正法山，　　行諸惡戒法，　　棄諸如法行，　　捨諸勝妙法，　　拔除今佛法，　　不信不調伏，　　樂行諸惡行，　　諂偽誑世間，　　打破牟尼法，　　毀形習諸惡，　　兇暴及千行，　　依法誑世人，　　忿恨自貢高，　　貪著求名利，　　無惡業不備，　　如佛所說法，　　法沒有是相，　　今者悉已見，　　智者所輕賤，　　此法今出已，　　牟尼正法海，　　不久當枯竭，　　正法今少在，　　惡人復來滅，　　毀壞我正法。』
translation: And he spoke the verse, saying, 'Unlucky people who engage in bad behavior and wrong views, foolish people who destroy the mountain of the right Dharma, practice bad morality, abandon practices that accord with the Dharma, abandon excellent and wonderful teachings, uproot the present Buddha's teaching, disbelieve and fail to tame, enjoy practicing bad behavior, flatter and deceive the world, disparage the Muni teaching, disfigure and cultivate evil, commit savagery and a thousand other acts, deceive the world based on the Dharma, become hateful and proud, cling to fame and profit, do not prepare for bad actions, teach as the Buddha taught, the Dharma has no such characteristics, which have all been seen today and are despised by the wise, this Dharma has now emerged, the ocean of the Muni right Dharma will soon dry up, the right Dharma is now scant, and evil people will come back to extinguish it and disparage our right Dharma.'

source_sentence: 「時，彼諸天、龍、神等皆生不歡喜心，不復當護諸比丘，而同聲唱言：『佛法却後七日滅盡。』
translation: "At the time, those gods, dragons, and spirits all became unhappy and stopped protecting the monks, singing with one voice, 'The Buddha's teaching will cease seven days from now.'

source_sentence: 號咷悲泣，共相謂言：『至比丘說戒日，共相鬪諍，如來正法於中而滅。』
translation: They all wailed and lamented, saying, 'On the day the monks taught the precepts, they fought each other, and the Tathāgata's right teaching ceased in the midst of it.'

source_sentence: 如是諸天悲惱啼泣。
translation: The gods thus lamented and wept.

source_sentence: 「時，拘睒彌城中有五百優婆塞，聞諸天之言，共詣諸比丘眾中，諫諸比丘鬪諍，而說偈言：「『嗚呼苦劇歲，　　愍念群生生，　　其法今便滅，　　釋師子王法，　　惡輪壞法輪，　　如是盡金剛，　　乃能不即壞，　　安隱時已滅，　　危險法已起，　　明智人已過，　　今見如是相，　　當知不復久，　　牟尼法斷滅，　　世間無復明，　　離垢寂滅口，　　牟尼日今沒，　　世人失伏藏，　　善惡無差別，　　善惡無差已，　　誰能得正覺，　　法燈今在世，　　及時行諸善，　　無量諸福田，　　此法今當滅，　　是故我等輩，　　知財不堅牢，　　及時取堅實。』
translation: "Hearing what the gods said, five hundred laymen in Kauśāmbī went together to the monks, remonstrated with them, and spoke in verse, saying, 'Ahoy, bitter years!

source_sentence: 「至十五日說戒時，法當沒，今日五百優婆塞，一日之中，造五百佛塔。
translation: "When the precepts are taught on the fifteenth day, the Dharma will disappear, and today five hundred laymen will build five hundred Buddha stūpas in a single day.

source_sentence: 時，諸優婆塞各有餘務，不復來往眾僧眾中。
translation: At the time, the upāsaka had other duties and stopped coming and going to the congregation of monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 「爾時，住揵陀摩羅山修羅他阿羅漢觀閻浮提：『今日何處有眾僧說戒？』
translation: "At the time, the sūtra arhat living on Mount Gandhamāra observed to Jambudvīpa, 'Where are the saṃgha preaching the precepts today?'

source_sentence: 見有拘睒彌國如來弟子說戒為布薩，即詣拘睒彌。
translation: Seeing a disciple of the Tathāgata in Kauśāmbī who taught the precepts as a preceptor, he went to Kauśāmbī.

source_sentence: 「時，彼僧眾乃有百千人，中唯有一阿羅漢，名曰修羅他。
translation: "At the time, there were a hundred thousand monks in that congregation, and the only one among them was an arhat named Sūlâditya.

source_sentence: 又復有一三藏，名曰弟子，此是如來最後大眾集。
translation: There was also one tripiṭaka named Disciple, which was the last great assembly of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 爾時，維那行舍羅籌，白三藏上座言：『眾僧已集，有百千人，今為說波羅提木叉。』
translation: At the time, Venerable Viśeṣaṇḍa said to the tripiṭaka's superior, 'The saṃgha has assembled, and there are a hundred thousand of them; now let's talk about prātimokṣa.'

source_sentence: 時，彼上座答言：『閻浮提如來弟子皆來集此，數有百千。
translation: The patron then replied, 'The disciples of the Tathāgata of Jambudvī have gathered here, and they number a hundred thousand.

source_sentence: 如是眾中，我為上首，了達三藏，尚不學戒律，況復餘者而有所學。
translation: Of such a crowd, I'm the head, and I've mastered the Tripiṭaka, but I still haven't studied the precepts, so why would the rest of you want to study them?

source_sentence: 今當為誰而說戒律？』
translation: For whom will I now expound the precepts and regulations?'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『今是十五日，　　夜靜月清明，　　如是諸比丘，　　今集聽說戒，　　一切閻浮提，　　眾僧最後集，　　我是眾中上，　　不學戒律法，　　況復餘僧眾，　　而有所學習，　　何能牟尼法，　　釋迦師子王，　　彼戒誰有持，　　是人乃能說。』
translation: He spoke the verse, saying, 'Now, it's the fifteenth day, the night is still and the moon is clear, and these monks have gathered here to hear the precepts being taught, and all of Jambudvīpa is the last place where all the monks have gathered, and I'm the best of the lot who haven't studied the precepts and the Dharma, let alone the rest of the monks who have studied them, how could I be a muni, the lion king of the Śākyas, who upholds those precepts and who is the one who can teach them?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼阿羅漢修羅他立上座前，合掌白上座言：『上座！
translation: "At the time, that arhat Sholāta stood in front of the throne, put his palms together, and said to the throne, 'Throne!

source_sentence: 但說波羅提木叉，如佛在世時，舍利弗、目揵連等大比丘眾所學法，我今已悉學。
translation: Just say, 'Prātimokṣa, if it were the case when the Buddha was alive, I would have studied all the teachings that were taught by Śāriputra, Maudgalyāyana, and other great assembly of monks.

source_sentence: 如來雖滅度，於今已千歲，彼所制律儀，我悉已備足。』
translation: Although the Tathāgata died and passed away, it's been a thousand years since then, and I've completed all of the precepts that he prescribed.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『上座聽我說，　　我名修羅他，　　漏盡阿羅漢，　　僧中師子吼。
translation: He spoke the verse, saying, 'Sir, listen to me, I'm called a sūtra, an arhat whose contaminants have ended, and a lion's roar among the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 牟尼真弟子，　　信佛諸鬼神，　　聞彼聖所說，　　悲哀泣流淚。
translation: True disciples of the Muni, faithful Buddhas and spirits hear what these sages teach, and they weep tears of sorrow.

source_sentence: 低頭念法滅，　　從今去已後，　　無有說法者，　　毘尼別解脫。
translation: They bow their heads in remembrance of the cessation of the teaching, and from now on there's no Dharma preacher or Vini's individual liberation.

source_sentence: 不復在於世，　　法橋今已壞，　　法水不復流，　　法海已枯竭。
translation: No longer in the world, the bridge of the Dharma has now broken down, the Dharma water no longer flows, and the Dharma ocean has dried up.

source_sentence: 法山已崩頹，　　法會從今絕，　　法幢不復見，　　法足不復行。
translation: The Dharma mountain has crumbled, the Dharma assembly has now ceased, the Dharma banner is no longer visible, and the Dharma leg is no longer practiced.

source_sentence: 律儀戒永沒，　　法燈不復照，　　法輪不復轉，　　閉塞甘露門。
translation: The precepts of discipline have permanently disappeared, the Dharma lamp no longer shines, the Dharma wheel no longer turns, and the door to the ambrosia is closed.

source_sentence: 法師不在世，　　善人說妙道，　　眾生不識善，　　不異於野獸。』
translation: When the Dharma teacher is absent from the world and a good person teaches the wondrous way, sentient beings who don't know what's good are no different than wild animals.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛母摩訶摩耶夫人天上來下，詣諸眾僧所，號咷啼泣：『嗚呼！
translation: "At the time, the Buddha's mother, Lady Mahāmāyā, came down from heaven and visited the monks, wailing and lamenting, 'Whoops!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 是我之子經歷阿僧祇劫，修諸苦行，不顧勞體，積德成佛，今者忽然消滅。』
translation: My son has gone through incalculably long eons of ascetic practices, cultivated austerities, and accumulated virtue to become a buddha despite his physical troubles, and now he's suddenly extinguished.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『我是佛親母，　　我子積苦行，　　經歷無數劫，　　究竟成真道。
translation: He spoke the verse, saying, 'I'm the Buddha's dear mother, and my son has accumulated painful practices for countless eons to finally achieve the true path.

source_sentence: 悲泣不自勝，　　今法忽磨滅，　　嗚呼智慧人，　　爾今何所在。
translation: My lamentations were overwhelming, but now the Dharma has suddenly disappeared.' 'O wise man, where is it now?'

source_sentence: 持法捨諍訟，　　從佛口所生，　　諸王無上尊，　　真實佛弟子。
translation: Holding the Dharma and rejecting strife, he was born from the Buddha's mouth, the unsurpassed king, and truly the Buddha's disciple.

source_sentence: 頭陀修妙行，　　宿止林藪間，　　如是真佛子，　　今為何所在。
translation: The ascetic cultivates wondrous practices and stays in the forest and the swamps, so where is this true son of the Buddha now?

source_sentence: 今者於世間，　　無有諸威德，　　曠野山林間，　　諸神寂無言。
translation: Here in the world, he has no authority, lives in the wilderness, in the mountains and forests, and his spirits are silent.

source_sentence: 施戒愍群生，　　信戒自莊嚴，　　忍辱質直行，　　觀察諸善惡。
translation: He was kind to sentient beings, adorned himself in faith and morality, conducted himself with patience and modesty, and observed what was good and evil.

source_sentence: 如是諸勝法，　　今忽都已盡。』
translation: All of these excellent qualities have suddenly been exhausted.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼上座弟子作是念言：『彼修羅他比丘自言：「如來所制戒律，我悉備持。」』
translation: "At the time, that senior disciple had this thought, 'That monk Sholāta said to himself, 'I have maintained all the precepts that the Tathāgata has established.'

source_sentence: 爾時，上座有弟子，名曰安伽陀，起不忍之心，極生忿恨。
translation: At the time, a disciple of the elder monk's named Angada became intolerant and extremely angry.

source_sentence: 從座起，罵辱彼聖：『汝是下座比丘，愚癡無智，而毀辱我和上。』
translation: He got up from his seat and insulted that sage, saying, 'You're a lower-seated monk, foolish and without wisdom, and you're insulting me and the superior.'

source_sentence: 即持利刀，殺彼聖人，而說偈言：「『我名安伽陀，　　失沙之弟子，　　利劍殺汝身，　　自謂我有德。』
translation: Armed with a sharp sword, he killed that sage and spoke a verse, saying, 'My name is Angada, disciple of Śākyamuni, and I've killed you with a sharp sword, claiming to be virtuous.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，有一鬼名曰大提木佉，作是念言：『世間唯有此一阿羅漢，而為惡比丘弟子所害。』
translation: "At the time, there was a ghost named Dattatreya Mukha who had this thought, 'Is this the only arhat in the world who's been harmed by a bad disciple of a monk?'

source_sentence: 執持金剛利杵，杵頭火然，以此打破彼頭，即便命終，而說偈言：「『我是惡鬼神，　　名大提木佉，　　以此金剛杵，　　破汝頭七分。』
translation: Holding a vajra-tipped pounder with its fiery head, he broke his head with it even as his life ended and spoke a verse, saying, 'I'm a bad spirit named Dattamukha, and with this vajra-tipped pounder, I've broken seven parts of your head.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，阿羅漢弟子見彼弟子殺害其師，忿恨不忍，即殺三藏。
translation: "Seeing that disciple killing his teacher, the arhat's disciple became angry and intolerant, and he killed the Tripiṭaka.

source_sentence: 爾時，諸天、世人悲哀啼泣：『嗚呼！
translation: At the time, the gods and people of the world lamented and wept, 'Ouch!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 如來正法今便都盡。』
translation: Now, the Tathāgata's true teaching will be completely exhausted.'

source_sentence: 尋即此大地六種震動，無量眾生號咷啼泣，極為愁惱：『嗚呼！
translation: As a result, this earth trembles in six ways, and measureless sentient beings wail and lament, utterly distressed, 'Whoops!

source_sentence: 今日正法不復現世。』
translation: Today, the right teaching won't reappear in the world.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，各各離散。
translation: After saying this, they each scattered.

source_sentence: 「爾時，拘睒彌國五百優婆塞聞已，往詣寺中，舉手拍頭，高聲大哭：『嗚呼！
translation: "After hearing this, the five hundred Upāsaka of Kauśāmbī went to the temple, raised their hands, clapped their heads, and cried out, 'Ahoy!

source_sentence: 如來愍念世間，濟諸群生，無有巨細，誰當為我說法義？
translation: "Tathāgata, who will explain the meaning of the Dharma for me, considering the world and the sentient beings he helps, no matter how great or small?

source_sentence: 今者，人、天解脫不復可得，眾生今日猶在闇瞑，無有引導，長習諸惡，以此為歡，如諸野獸；不聞牟尼妙法，身壞命終，墮在三塗。
translation: Now, liberation for humans and gods is no longer possible, and sentient beings today are still in the dark, without guidance, long accustomed to bad habits, and delighting in this, like wild animals; they don't hear the wondrous Dharma of Muni, and when their bodies break up and their lives end, they fall into the three destinies.

source_sentence: 譬如流星，世人從今已後，無復念慧、寂靜、三昧、十力妙法。』
translation: Like a shooting star, people from now on will never again remember the wondrous qualities of wisdom, tranquility, concentration, and the ten powers.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，拘睒彌王聞諸比丘殺真人阿羅漢及三藏法師，心生悲惱，惋慨而坐。
translation: "It was then that the king of Kauśāmbī heard that the monks had killed a real arhat and a Tripiṭaka teacher, and he sat down in pity and sadness.

source_sentence: 爾時，諸邪見輩諍競打破塔廟，及害比丘，從是佛法索然頓滅。」
translation: At the time, the groups of wrong viewers fought over the breaking down of the stūpa and the harming of the monks, and thus the Buddha's teaching suddenly ceased."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊語釋提桓因：「四大天王，諸天、世人於我滅度之後，法盡之相，如上所說。
translation: The Bhagavān then said to Śakra Devānām-Indra, "The four great celestial kings, gods, and humans will see the end of the Dharma after I die out, just as I described above.

source_sentence: 是故汝等，今者不可不以勤力加於精進，護持正法，久令在世。」
translation: Therefore, you mustn't fail to exert yourselves with diligence and effort to safeguard the right teaching so that it can remain in the world for a long time."

source_sentence: 爾時，諸天、世人聞佛所說，各各悲顏，以手揮淚，頂禮佛足，各自退去。
translation: At that point, the gods and humans who heard what the Buddha taught each had compassionate faces, waved their hands in tears, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, and withdrew.

source_sentence: （六四一）阿育王施半阿摩勒果因緣經
translation: (6:41) Sutra on the Causes and Conditions of King Aśoka's Wish for Half an Amalekite

source_sentence: 阿育王於如來法中得大敬信。
translation: King Asoka attained great reverence and faith in the Tathāgata's teaching.

source_sentence: 時，王問諸比丘言：「誰於如來法中行大布施？」
translation: The king then asked the monks, "Who is practicing great generosity in the Tathāgata's teaching?"

source_sentence: 諸比丘白王言：「給孤獨長者最行大施。」
translation: The monks said to the king, "Give that lonely elder the most generous gift."

source_sentence: 王復問曰：「彼施幾許寶物？」
translation: The king then asked, "How much treasure has he given?"

source_sentence: 比丘答曰：「以億千金。」
translation: The monk replied, "For a hundred million pieces of gold."

source_sentence: 王聞已。
translation: After the king heard this, he thought.

source_sentence: 如是思惟：「彼長者尚能捨億千金，我今為王，何緣復以億千金施？
translation: He thus thought, "That elder could still spare a hundred million pieces of gold, but now that I'm the king, why would I give a hundred million pieces of gold?

source_sentence: 當以億百千金施。」
translation: You will give billions of thousands of gold as alms."

source_sentence: 時，王起八萬四千佛塔，於彼諸塔中復施百千金，復作五歲大會，會有三百千比丘，用三百億金供養於彼僧眾中。
translation: The king then erected 84,000 Buddha-stūpas, gave another hundred thousand pieces of gold in each of those stūpas, and then held a five-year assembly that brought together 3,000,000 monks to make offerings of 30 billion pieces of gold to that congregation of monks.

source_sentence: 第一分是阿羅漢，第二分是學人，第三分是真實凡夫。
translation: The first part was for arhats, the second part was for trainees, and the third part was for true worldlings.

source_sentence: 除私庫藏，此閻浮提夫人、婇女、太子、大臣施與聖僧，四十億金還復贖取。
translation: Except for their private treasury, the four billion pieces of gold that this woman, woman of Jambudvīpa, prince, and minister gave to the noble monks was redeemed.

source_sentence: 如是計挍，用九十六億千金，乃至王得重病時，王自知命欲終盡。
translation: After counting it this way, he spent 9,600,000,000 pieces of gold, up to the point where the king became gravely ill and knew that his life was about to end.

source_sentence: 時，有大臣名羅陀崛多。
translation: At the time, there was a minister named Rātarāṣṭra.

source_sentence: 時，王宿命是施佛土時同伴小兒。
translation: The king's previous life had been that of a young child who accompanied him when he gave alms to the Buddha's land.

source_sentence: 時，彼大臣羅陀崛多見王重病，命垂欲盡，稽首以偈問王：「顏貌常鮮澤，　　百千婇女遶，　譬如諸蓮華，　　蜜蜂當聚集，　今覩聖王顏，　　無有諸鮮澤。」
translation: When that minister Radhātaratna saw that the king was seriously ill and approaching the end of his life, he bowed his head and asked the king in a verse, "His face is always fresh and lustrous, surrounded by a hundred thousand women, like lotus flowers, and honeybees will gather around him, but now the face of the noble king has no such fresh luster."

source_sentence: 王即以偈答：「我今無所憂，　　失財及王位，　此身及餘親，　　及諸種種寶，　我今所愁者，　　不復覩賢聖，　四事以供養，　　我今唯念此，　顏色有變異，　　心意無所寧。
translation: The king then replied with a verse, "Now, I have no sorrow, for I've lost my wealth and my position as king, this body and others, and all kinds of treasures.

source_sentence: 「又復，我常所願，欲以滿億百千金作功德，今願不得滿足，便就後世時，計挍前後所施金銀珍寶，唯減四億未滿。」
translation: "Furthermore, my long-cherished desire to contribute hundreds of millions of gold as a merit has not been fulfilled, so now I'm counting the gold and silver treasures I've given before and after in a later life, and it's only 400 million less than it was."

source_sentence: 王即辦諸珍寶，送與鷄雀寺中。
translation: The king then prepared the treasures and sent them to the temple of Aṅgulimāla.

source_sentence: 法益之子，名三波提，為太子諸臣等，啟太子言：「大王將終不久，今以此珍寶送與寺舍中，今庫藏財寶已竭，諸王法以物為尊，太子今宜斷之，勿使大王用盡也。」
translation: The son of Fayi, named Sambodhi, told the prince and his ministers, "The king will soon be finished, so he's sending this treasure to the temple's residence.

source_sentence: 時，太子即勅典藏者，勿復出與大王用之。
translation: The prince then ordered the treasurer not to release it again for the king's use.

source_sentence: 時，大王自知索諸物不復能得，所食金器送與寺中。
translation: Knowing that he wouldn't be able to get any more of the things he asked for, the king gave the gold vessel he was eating to the temple.

source_sentence: 時，太子令斷金器，給以銀器，王食已，復送與寺中。
translation: The prince then ordered that the gold vessel be cut off and a silver vessel be given to the king, which was then returned to the temple after the king had eaten.

source_sentence: 又斷銀器，給以銅器，王亦以此送與寺中。
translation: He also cut off the silver vessel and gave it to the king as a bronze vessel, which he also gave to the temple.

source_sentence: 又斷銅器，給以瓦器。
translation: He also cut off the bronze vessel and gave it to the monastery as a tile vessel.

source_sentence: 時，大王手中有半阿摩勒果，悲淚告諸大臣：「今誰為地主？」
translation: The king then had a half-amalā fruit in his hand and told the ministers with tears of pity, "Who is the lord of the land now?"

source_sentence: 時，諸臣啟白大王：「王為地主。」
translation: The ministers then revealed to the king, "The king is the lord of the land."

source_sentence: 時，王即說偈答曰：「汝等護我心，　　何假虛妄語，　我今坐王位，　　不復得自在。
translation: The king then replied in verse, "You guard my mind, so why would you say something false when I'm sitting on the throne now and won't be able to be free again?

source_sentence: 阿摩勒半果，　　今在於我手，　此即是我物，　　於是得自由。
translation: Now, the half-fruit of amalā is in my hand, and this is my property, so I've gained my freedom.

source_sentence: 嗚呼尊富貴，　　可厭可棄捨，　先領閻浮提，　　今一旦貧至。
translation: O my lord, the rich and powerful, which can be tired and discarded, first led to Jambudvīpa, but now once I'm poor, I'll reach it.

source_sentence: 如恒河駛流，　　一逝而不返，　富貴亦復然，　　逝者不復還。」
translation: Like the Ganges River flowing down, it passes away and doesn't return, so too do wealth and riches, which never return."

source_sentence: 又復，如佛偈所說：「凡盛必有衰，　　以衰為究竟，　如來神口說，　　真實無有異，　先時所教令，　　速疾無有閡，　今有所求索，　　無復從我教，　如風閡於山，　　如水閡於岸，　我今所教令，　　於今已永絕，　將從無量眾，　　擊鼓吹貝螺，　常作諸伎樂，　　受諸五欲樂，　婇女數百眾，　　日夜自娛樂，　今者都永盡，　　如樹無花實，　顏貌轉枯盡，　　色力亦復然，　如花轉萎悴，　　我今亦復爾。」
translation: Again, as the Buddha said in the verse, "Every prosperity must decline, and it's decline that's the ultimate, as the Tathāgata's spirits say, 'There's no difference between the truth and reality,' and what was taught and ordered in the past was swift and unobstructed, but now when I seek something, I teach it no more, as the wind tilts the mountains and the water tilts the shore, so now my teaching and order have been permanently extinguished, and I will follow countless multitudes, beat drums, blow shells and conchs, perform tricks and music, enjoy the five pleasures, and have hundreds of women who entertain themselves day and night, but now they're all permanently extinguished, like a tree without flowers or fruit, their appearance withers, and their strength of form likewise, like a flower that withers, so do I."

source_sentence: 時，阿育王呼侍者言：「汝今憶我恩養，汝持此半阿摩勒果送鷄雀寺中，作我意，禮拜諸比丘僧足，白言：『阿育王問訊諸大聖眾，我是阿育王，領此閻浮提，閻浮提是我所有，今者頓盡，無有財寶布施眾僧，於一切財而不得自在。
translation: King Aśoka then summoned his attendant and said, "Now, remember my kindness; take this half-amalā fruit and send it to the monastery of Aṅgulimāla, do as I wish, venerate the feet of the monks and saṃgha, and say, 'King Aśoka asks the great sages, 'I am King Aśoka, who controls Jambudvī and owns Jambudvī, but now it's suddenly ended, and there's no treasure to give to the saṃgha, and I'm not at ease with all my possessions.

source_sentence: 今唯此半阿摩勒果，我得自由，此是最後布施檀波羅蜜，哀愍我故，納受此施，令我得供養僧福。』
translation: Now, I've only attained freedom because of this half-amalā, which is the final gift of almsgiving to the almsgiver Don Bosco, so kindly accept this gift and allow me to provide for the merit of the saṃgha.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「半阿摩勒果，　　是我之所有，　於我得自在，　　今捨於大眾。
translation: He spoke the verse, saying, "This half-amalā fruit is mine, and I've attained freedom from it; now I'm giving it to the public.

source_sentence: 緣心在於聖，　　更無濟我者，　憐愍於我故，　　納受阿摩勒。
translation: With the minds of the sages and no one else to help me, I accept the amalā for my pity.

source_sentence: 為我食此施，　　因是福無量，　世世受妙樂，　　用之無有盡。」
translation: Eat this offering for me, for it's merit is immeasurable, and you'll experience marvelous pleasure from generation to generation, whose use will never end."

source_sentence: 時，彼使者受王勅已，即持此半阿摩勒果，至鷄雀寺中，至上座前，五體著地作禮，長跪合掌，向上座而說偈曰：「領於閻浮提，　　一繖繫一鼓，　遊行無所礙，　　如日照於世，　業行報已至，　　在世不復久，　無有王威德，　　如日雲所翳，　號曰阿育王，　　稽首禮僧足，　送此布施物，　　謂半阿摩勒，　願求來世福，　　哀愍彼王故，　聖眾愍彼故，　　受是半果施。」
translation: After receiving the king's order, the messenger took this half-amalā fruit and went to the Kukkuṭīrti temple, bowed with his five bodies on the ground in front of the supreme throne, knelt down with his palms together, and spoke a verse to the supreme throne, saying, "Lead them to Jambudvīpa, bind one umbrella to one drum, travel without obstruction, like the sun shining in the world, the rewards of karma and conduct having arrived, not long in the world, lacking the king's authority and virtue, like the sun and clouds that cover them, called Aśoka, bowed his head at the feet of the saṃgha, presented this offering, which is half an amalā, seeking merit in the future, because of my compassion for the king and the compassion of the noble people, and accepted this gift of half a fruit."

source_sentence: 時，彼上座告諸大眾：「誰聞是語而不厭世間？
translation: The ascetic then addressed the crowd, "Who hears this talk and doesn't grow weary of the world?

source_sentence: 我等聞是事，不可不生厭離，如佛經所說。
translation: We mustn't hear these things and not become disillusioned with them, just as the Buddhist sūtras say.

source_sentence: 見他衰事，應生厭離，若有識類眾生者，聞是事豈得不捨世間？」
translation: If we see the debilitating events of others, we should become disillusioned with them; if there are sentient beings of this type, how could we hear about such things and not abandon the world?"

source_sentence: 而說偈曰：「人王世中最，　　阿育孔雀姓，　閻浮提自在，　　阿摩勒為主，　太子及諸臣，　　共奪大王施，　送半阿摩勒，　　降伏憍財者，　使彼生厭心，　　愚夫不識施，　因果受妙樂，　　示送半摩勒。」
translation: He spoke the verse, "The king of men is the best in the world, Aśoka Kongak, Jambudvīpa, Amalā as lord, the princes and ministers who together seize the great king's alms, sending half an amalā, subduing the wealthy, making them become disillusioned, foolish people who don't know how to give, and receiving the wonderful pleasure of cause and effect, showing them half an amalā."

source_sentence: 時，彼上座作是念言：「云何令此半阿摩勒，一切眾僧得其分食？」
translation: The ascended master then had this thought, "How could this half-amalā be shared with all the saṃgha for food?"

source_sentence: 即教令研磨，著石榴羹中，行已，眾僧一切皆得周遍。
translation: He then instructed them to grind it and put it in a pomegranate potion, and after they did so, the monks were able to thoroughly pervade it.

source_sentence: 時，王復問傍臣曰：「誰是閻浮提王？」
translation: The king then asked another minister, "Who is King Jambudvīpa?"

source_sentence: 臣啟王言：「大王是也。」
translation: The ministers then instructed the king, saying, "So it is, Great King."

source_sentence: 時，王從臥起而坐，顧望四方，合掌作禮，念諸佛德，心念口言：「我今復以此閻浮提施與三寶，隨意用之。」
translation: The king then rose from his bed and sat down, looked in all directions, put his palms together in prostration, remembered the virtues of the buddhas, and said to himself, "Now, I'll give this Jambudvīpa to the Three Treasures and use it as I like."

source_sentence: 而說偈曰：「今此閻浮提，　　多有珍寶飾，　施與良福田，　　果報自然得，　以此施功德，　　不求天帝釋，　梵王及人主，　　世界諸妙樂，　如是等果報，　　我悉不用受，　以是施功德，　　疾得成佛道，　為世所尊仰，　　成得一切智，　世間作善友，　　導師最第一。」
translation: He spoke a verse, saying, "Now, this Jambudvīpa is richly adorned with treasures, and it's a good field of merit to bestow, so the rewards come naturally.

source_sentence: 時，王以此語盡書紙上，而封緘之，以齒印印之。
translation: The king then wrote all of these words on a piece of paper, sealed it, and sealed it with a dental seal.

source_sentence: 作如是事畢，便即就盡。
translation: After doing so, he then put an end to it.

source_sentence: 爾時，太子及諸臣、宮人、婇女、國界人民，興種種供養葬送，如王之法而闍維之。
translation: At the time, the crown prince and his ministers, court officials, Ṛṣipatana women, and the people of the country made various offerings and gave funeral rites, maintaining them according to the king's wishes.

source_sentence: 爾時，諸臣欲立太子紹王位，中有一大臣，名曰阿[少/兔]羅陀，語諸臣曰：「不得立太子為王。
translation: At the time, the ministers wanted to appoint the crown prince to the throne, but a minister named [Shao/Hare] Rādhā said to the ministers, "You can't appoint the crown prince as king.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 大王阿育在時，本誓願滿十萬億金作諸功德，唯減四億，不滿十萬，以是故，今捨閻浮提施與三寶，欲令滿足。
translation: When King Aśoka was here, he originally vowed to achieve a hundred thousand million gold pieces of merit, but his vow was reduced by four hundred million, which wasn't enough for a hundred thousand.

source_sentence: 今是大地屬於三寶，云何而立為王？」
translation: Now, since the great earth belongs to the Three Treasures, how was it established as king?"

source_sentence: 時，諸臣聞已，即送四億諸金，送與寺中，即便立法益之子為王，名三波提。
translation: When the ministers heard this, they sent 400 million pieces of gold to the temple, and they made the son of Legion of Merit king named Sambodhi.

source_sentence: 次復太子，名毘梨訶波低，為紹王位，毘梨訶波低太子，名曰毘梨訶西那，次紹王位。
translation: The next prince, named Vṛhatphala, assumed the position of king, and the prince Vṛhatphala, named Vṛhatshina, assumed the position of king.

source_sentence: 毘梨訶西那太子，名曰沸沙須摩，次紹王位。
translation: The crown prince Vṛhasena, named Vairocana, was next in line to ascend to the throne.

source_sentence: 沸沙須摩太子，名曰沸沙蜜多羅，次紹王位。
translation: Prince Boonsa Suma, named Boonsa Maitrāyaniputra, was next in line to the throne.

source_sentence: 時，沸沙蜜多羅問諸臣曰：「我當作何等事，令我名德久存於世？」
translation: Boonsa Maitrāyaniputra then asked his ministers, "What will I do to preserve my reputation and virtue in the world for a long time?"

source_sentence: 時，賢善諸臣信樂三寶者，啟王言：「阿育大王是王之前種姓，彼王在世，造立八萬四千如來塔，復興種種供養，此之名德，相傳至今。
translation: Good ministers who believed in the Three Treasures then inspired the king, saying, "Aśoka the Great was a member of the king's prior family, and when he was alive, he built 84,000 tathāgata stūpas and made various offerings, which have been handed down to this day as being of such renown and virtue.

source_sentence: 王欲求此名者，當造立八萬四千塔，及諸供養。」
translation: The king who wants to claim that name should erect 84,000 stūpas and make offerings."

source_sentence: 王言：「大王阿育有大威德，能辦此事，我不能作，更思餘事。」
translation: The king said, "Great King Aśoka has great authority and virtue to do this; I couldn't do it; let's consider something else."

source_sentence: 中有惡臣，不信向者，啟王言：「世間二種法傳世不滅，一者作善，二者作惡。
translation: A minister of ill-will who didn't believe in the Way inspired the king, saying, "There are two kinds of things in the world that are transmitted from one generation to the next and don't perish: those that are good and those that are bad.

source_sentence: 大王阿育作諸善行，王今當行惡行，打壞八萬四千塔。」
translation: Great King Aśoka has done good deeds, but now the king will do bad deeds and smash 84,000 stūpas."

source_sentence: 時，王用侫臣語，即興四兵眾，往詣寺舍，壞諸塔寺。
translation: Using the words of his squeezing ministers, the king then sent a group of four soldiers to the monastery to destroy the stūpas and temples.

source_sentence: 王先往鷄雀寺中，寺門前有石師子，即作師子吼。
translation: The king first went to the Kurkuṭārāma temple, but there was a stone lion in front of the temple gate that made a lion's roar.

source_sentence: 王聞之即大驚怖，非生獸之類，而能吼鳴，還入城中。
translation: When the king heard it, he was terrified that it wasn't a living animal that could roar, and he went back into the city.

source_sentence: 如是再三，欲壞彼寺。
translation: He did this three times and wanted to destroy the temple.

source_sentence: 時，王呼諸比丘來，問諸比丘：「使我壞塔為善？
translation: The king then summoned the monks and asked them, "Would it be good for me to destroy the stūpa?

source_sentence: 壞僧房為善？」
translation: Is it good to destroy the saṃgha's quarters?"

source_sentence: 比丘答曰：「二不應行。
translation: The monks replied, "Two things shouldn't be done.

source_sentence: 王其欲壞者，寧壞僧房，勿壞佛塔。」
translation: If the king wants to destroy them, he'd better destroy the saṃgha's quarters than the stūpa."

source_sentence: 時，王殺害比丘，及壞塔寺。
translation: The king then killed the monks and destroyed the stūpa.

source_sentence: 如是漸漸至婆伽羅國，又復唱令：「若有人能得沙門釋子頭來者，賞之千金。」
translation: He gradually reached the country of Bṛhatphala like this and again ordered, "If anyone can obtain the head of the ascetic Śāriputra, they'll be rewarded a thousand pieces of gold."

source_sentence: 爾時，彼國中有一阿羅漢，化作眾多比丘頭，與諸百姓，令送至於王所，令王庫藏財寶竭盡。
translation: At the time, there was an arhat in that country who took the form of the heads of many monks and sent them with the people to the king's residence, causing the king's treasury to be depleted of its wealth and possessions.

source_sentence: 時，彼王聞阿羅漢作如是事，倍復瞋恚，欲殺彼阿羅漢。
translation: When the king heard that arhat had done that, he became even more angry and wanted to kill that arhat.

source_sentence: 時，彼羅漢入滅盡正受，王作無量方便，殺彼聖人，終不能得。
translation: When that arhat entered into the correct feeling of cessation, the king made measureless preparations to kill that saint, but he was never able to do so.

source_sentence: 入滅盡三昧力故，不傷其體。
translation: Because of the power of the samādhi of entering into cessation, he wasn't harmed physically.

source_sentence: 如是漸進至佛塔門邊。
translation: He thus gradually advanced to the entrance of the Buddha's stūpa.

source_sentence: 彼所塔中，有一鬼神，止住其中，守護佛塔，名曰牙齒。
translation: Inside that stūpa, there's a demon named Teeth that lives inside and guards the stūpa.

source_sentence: 彼鬼神作是念：「我是佛弟子，受持禁戒，不殺害眾生，我今不能殺害於王。」
translation: The demon thought, "I'm a disciple of the Buddha who observes the precepts and doesn't kill sentient beings, so now I can't kill the king."

source_sentence: 又復作念：「有一神名曰為蟲，行諸惡行，兇暴勇健，求索我女，我不與之；今者為護正法故，當嫁與彼，令其守護佛法。」
translation: Again, he thought, "There's a spirit named We Bug who does bad things, is fierce and courageous, and asks for my daughter, but I won't give her away; now, in order to protect the right teaching, I will give her in marriage so that she can protect the Buddha's teaching."

source_sentence: 即呼彼神語言：「我今嫁女與汝，然共立約誓，汝要當降伏此王，勿使興諸惡行，壞滅正法。」
translation: He then summoned that spirit and said, "Now, I'll give you my daughter in marriage, but we've made a mutual vow that you will subdue this king and not allow him to do any bad deeds that would destroy the right teaching."

source_sentence: 時，王所有一大鬼神，名曰烏茶，威德具足，故彼神不奈王何。
translation: The king then had a large demon named Ucha with complete authority, so that god couldn't help the king.

source_sentence: 時，牙齒神作方便，今日王威勢自然由此鬼神，我今誘誑共作親厚。
translation: The tooth god then made a plan, saying, "Today, this demon naturally gives the king authority, and I will now entice and make it intimate with him.

source_sentence: 如是與彼神作知識，極作知識已，即將此神至於南方大海中。
translation: He thus made himself known to that spirit, and after making himself known to him, he sent this spirit south to the ocean.

source_sentence: 時彼蟲神排攩大山，推迮王上，及四兵眾，無不死盡。
translation: That bug spirit then lined up a large mountain, pushed the king up, and killed every one of his four soldiers.

source_sentence: 眾人唱言：「快哉！
translation: The crowd chanted, "How wonderful!

source_sentence: 快哉！」
translation: Happy!"

source_sentence: 是世人相傳，名為快哉。
translation: This is called pleasure, as it's handed down from person to person.

source_sentence: 彼王終亡，孔雀苗裔於此永終，是故世間富樂不足為貪。
translation: When that king dies, the peacock's descendants will die here forever, so worldly wealth and happiness aren't enough to crave.

source_sentence: 阿育大王有智之人，覺世無常，身命難保，五家財物亦如幻化。
translation: Aśoka, the great king, is a man of wisdom who realizes that the world is impermanent, that his body and life are difficult to preserve, and that the possessions of his five families are illusory.

source_sentence: 覺了彼法，勤行精進，作諸功德，乃至臨終，係心三寶，念念不絕，無所悋惜，唯願盡成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: He realizes this teaching, diligently practices it, makes merits, and attaches his mind to the Three Treasures until his dying day, never stopping to think about them, never cherishing anything but the ultimate realization of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 雜阿含經卷第二十五
translation: Za'ahan jing, vol. 25
